content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, the following function `clean_column` will clean up a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ .\-]+" => "_")
end
```

The `replace()` method is used to replace all occurrences of one or more spaces, hyphens or periods with an underscore. The regular expression `"[ .\-]+"` matches one or more spaces, hyphens or periods in the string. 

The `strip()` function is then used to remove any leading or trailing whitespaces from the string. Lastly, the `lowercase()` method is applied to convert all characters in the string to lowercase.
